The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear white or pale yellow flowers, which are often followed by dark blue to black berries. Peckia longifolia is typically found in swampy or seasonally flooded habitats, where it thrives in the moist, nutrient-rich soil. Its ornamental value has made it a subject of interest for horticulturists and botanists alike.
